channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Damaged pavements, 1st November
item.description:
Potholes and damage areas with exposed cables.

item.title: Huge gap between the slabs, slabs move outside of no21, 1st November
item.description:
Gaps been here for months and pavement moves every time you walk over it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lovel Avenue, East Wickham, London

item.title: Street light blocked at the top of Hyde Drive (opposite number 1 Hyde drive), 1st November
item.description:
The street light is blocked by trees making it dangerous and unsafe at night when walking down the road. Blocks out light so the view is very dark
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Hyde Drive, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Outside 48 Baldwin’s garden, 1st November
item.description:
The drain is blocked and there is a large pool of water on the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Baldwins Gardens, Holborn, London

item.title: Flooding, 1st November
item.description:
Bromley Road junction of Beckenham Hill Road Crossing is always flooded. When we get heavy rain. Can the cause be investigated

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bromley Road, Southend, London

item.title: Peter street, 1st November
item.description:
Super loud noise engine running super loud.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Berwick Street, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gap in fence, 1st November
item.description:
There's a pole missing. People come in and out through this gap. It's been like this for so long there's actually a path worn in the grass between the gap and the path 5 yards away. I vaguely rememebr reporting this about 5 years ago. What's the point?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queen Elizabeths Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
LED Lamp not on at night
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stone Park Avenue, Eden Park, London

item.title: Flytipping, 1st November
item.description:
Wooden planks are on footpath on Ceres Road along the wall alongside Bannockburn School Has been here more than a week with stuff added during this week

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ceres Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Oops tag on postbox, 1st November
item.description:
Usual spray tagger has vandalised this red Royal Mail postbox on Thesiger Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thesiger Road, Penge, London

item.title: West End of Bartholomew Road, 1st November
item.description:
There are no trees on the north side of Bartholomew Road as it appears Bartholomew villas. It would be great if some could be planted
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Bartholomew Road, Kentish Town, London

item.description:
Asset ID: B1131. Black spray tag on yellow bollard, middle of road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whateley Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Too many leaves stretching from 3 Parish Lane to the bus stop, it’s dangerous when wet, 1st November
item.description:
Too many leaves, when are these due a clean up please? We’ve not had the street clean in a long time

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parish Lane, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction Elmstead Lane and St Keverne Road - temporary utility work signals, 1st November
item.description:
Vehicles continue to jump the temporary signal lights on Elmstead Lane at the utility works. Several vehicles continued through a red light today, whilst I was waiting at the head of a queue unable to move on a green light. Manually operated signals at peak times may be preferable, as I witnessed dangerous driving as a result of frustration from waiting vehicles,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmstead Lane, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Blocked drains, 1st November
item.description:
Leaves in gutter blocking drain which are in a flood risk area
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Great Thrift, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unauthorised lock box attached to lamppost, 1st November
item.description:
An unmarked lock box is attached to street lighting column 210 15 outside the 64 Sancroft St. For at least a year, people have been coming regularly to access it, often creating noise and disturbance, especially late in the evening. Please could the highways/street lighting team inspect, confirm whether this attachment is authorised, and remove it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sancroft Street, Lambeth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking on red route, 1st November
item.description:
Multiple cars parked on a red route. Narrowing road, causing queues making it dangerous to drive especially at night
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Vale, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive Number of Potholes, 1st November
item.description:
Again and again Bexley council ignoring the pot holes that are on this stretch of road. Same old excuse, we have no money. Sort it out!! People are swerving in the road to avoid and it’s an accident waiting to happen
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bellegrove Road, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bed frame/mattress in the 3rd lane, 1st November
item.description:
Half a bed frame and mattress I believe in the 3rd lane on the A13. I had to swerve the items luckily all fine but will cause an accident! The location may be slightly off as have me a bit of shock but it’s between just before the tilbury turn off and the Orsett turn off
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A13, Grays
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: HMO dumping again, 1st November
item.description:
We are sick of having HMOs in our street and having to put up with persistent dumping. Get rid of these kinds of people and unscrupulous landlords!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Piedmont Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
